@Nikita-tech-writer Actually, CDC is a common abbrevation in data processing - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Change_data_capture

Are you sure we should replace CDC to change data capture everywhere in documentation?

> @Nikita-tech-writer Actually, CDC is a common abbrevation in data processing - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Change_data_capture
> 
> Are you sure we should replace CDC to change data capture everywhere in documentation?

If you don't object, I would go for the full version of this term as it's a common practice to avoid abbreviations in the docs (except for the obvious things as formats (XML, TXT, SVG) or other stuff like SMS, LTE, SSL, etc.). It seems to me that CDC may confuse some of the users.
@nizhikov I have finished the review. Please see the remaining suggestions. Thank you!

> other stuff like SMS, LTE, SSL, etc

Actually, CDC is that kind of abbreviation :)

Take a look at cassandra docs - https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/cassandra/operating/cdc.html

> > other stuff like SMS, LTE, SSL, etc
> 
> Actually, CDC is that kind of abbreviation :)
> 
> Take a look at cassandra docs - https://cassandra.apache.org/doc/latest/cassandra/operating/cdc.html

OK, let's follow your lead :)
Then, I would suggest the same approach as Cassandra has: Let's mention the term once (at the beginning of the article) with the abbreviation in brackets ---> **Change data capture (CDC)**, and use only the **CDC** abbreviation in the rest of the text.

Thanks for your comment )

@Nikita-tech-writer  сhange doc to use abbrevation and fix your comment.
Can you, please, approve the changes?

> @Nikita-tech-writer сhange doc to use abbrevation and fix your comment. Can you, please, approve the changes?

Sure! Everything LGTM right now.
LGTM!

When the retry job executing asynchronously, the CacheOperationContext must be preserved.

SQL standard doesn't allow COUNT with multiple arguments.
So, let's just disable this feature.
Merged to sql-calcite branch

Seems, maven-surefire-plugin fails due to missed Ignite custom reporter class: TestSuiteAwareTestsetReporter.
Added ignite-tools dependency.

TC tests run successfuly.

https://ci.ignite.apache.org/viewLog.html?buildId=6401625&buildTypeId=IgniteTests24Java8_CalciteSql

mvn -Pcheckstyle,all-java,lgpl -DskipTests -Dmaven.javadoc.skip=true -Dmaven.source.skip=true package - ok
mvn test -DfailIfNoTests=false -Dtest=IntegrationTestSuite -am - ok
run tests from  IDE - ok

Hi, this patch LGTM. But I'm not sure, but maybe we should add some smoke tests that check connect a client to multiple nodes to be confident that the timer isn't shared between channels. We configure heartbeat on ClientConfiguration level, where also partition awareness configured. Then it looks meaningful and maybe it can be useful for regression testing, WDYT?
@timoninmaxim good point, I've enabled `PartitionAwareness` in `ClientHeartbeatTest`, I think it should cover the regression matters.
